bwwExcerpt: Breaking up the musical numbers, the nine cast members - with glasses similar to Prince's perched on their heads - offer flashbacks about how he got into the biz: Begging the venerable producer-director George Abbott for a job, raising money from the crew to put on "The Pajama Game," lucky breaks like taking over "West Side Story" when another producer backed out. Musical theater buffs will eat it up; those looking for something more challenging, not so much.
showScoreExcerpt:
"Basically a highlight reel of Prince's finest moments, two-plus hours of songs from major hits...Musical theater buffs will eat it up; those looking for something more challenging, not so much...The cast of Broadway powerhouses clearly wanted to do Prince proud, resulting in a sell that was too hard at times. And as in any revue, some roles were an easier fit than others."
